item.title: Recharge: Stress, Anxiety & Support During Crunch Time | Nov. 17
item.description: Date: Monday, November 17, 2025 6:00 AM - 7:00 AM - Discover ways to manage academic stress, test anxiety, and emotional regulation through wellness activities, mindfulness techniques, and student-led support. Includes a self-care kit and resource packet. Register Here: https://forms.office.com/Pages/ResponsePage.aspx?id=4VP2qs0LLEyGWBLrA-FXdNtLro-Zf1RHtKeMXgtgmKRUNEs0SFE3OFJGNlExVEY2V1o5OE01NloxSy4u

item.title: Gateway Shuttle for Thanksgiving Break
item.description: RPI’s Department of Parking and Transportation will again offer Gateway shuttle service to the Albany International Airport, Albany Bus Terminal, and Amtrak Train Station for Thanksgiving break. Shuttles depart from the RPI Student Union horseshoe via CDTA bus. To reserve a seat, email hosgob@rpi.edu or call 518-276-6616 by Wednesday, November 19. Please be sure to include your full name, RIN and which departure date and time you would like to sign up for.
item.author: Students

item.title: CHI EPSILON INITIATION | Nov. 17
item.description: Date: Monday, November 17, 2025 7:00 PM - 9:00 PM - Chi Epsilon in the national honor society for civil and environmental engineers at RPI. The initiates pledge to uphold the highest standards of scholarship, character, practicality and sociability. You must be invited to join but all are welcome to the ceremony.
item.author: Community

item.title: Thank you from the Office of Admissions!
item.description: We just want to take a moment to say thank you to everyone across campus who helped make our fall admissions events such a success! Across the five events, we hosted 836 prospective students (a total of 2,240 visitors).
item.author: Community

item.title: iEAR Presents! “The Story of Plastic” Screening and Panel Discussion | Nov. 15
item.description: As part of our Water Justice Lab End of Season Celebration, join us 11/15 at 7pm at the Sanctuary for Independent Media for a screening of the documentary “The Story of Plastic.” This sweeping look at the human-made crisis of plastic pollution and the worldwide effect it has on planetary and human health will be followed by an interdisciplinary panel discussion.
item.author: Community

item.title: Student Pantry Staffing “Take over” | Nov. 18
item.description: Date: Tuesday, November 18, 2025 (all day) - Is your Student Organization or Department interested in staffing the pantry for a day (3 hours)? Fill out the form to make the request. Definitely will need assistance during Finals week in December.
item.author: Community

item.title: Sydney Ross Lecture in Chemistry | Nov. 18
item.description: Date: Tuesday, November 18, 2025 4:00 PM - 5:00 PM - Michael F. Cunningham, Professor of Chemical Engineering at Queen’s University in Kingston, Canada, will speak about “Carbon Dioxide Responsive Polymers: Design, Properties and Applications”.
item.author: Community

item.title: Water Justice Lab End-of-Season Celebration
item.description: Join Riverkeeper and NATURE Lab along with our community science volunteers, fellows, family and friends to celebrate the 6th season of Water Justice Lab. Activities include researcher and youth fellow presentations and a community meal followed by a film screening of “The Story of Plastic” and panel. Open House: 3319 6th Ave, Troy; Screening: 3361 6th Ave, Troy
item.author: Community

item.title: Title IX and Beyond: Understand Your Rights
item.description: Join us for Title IX and Beyond, an informational session focused on understanding your rights, navigating personal and professional boundaries, and learning about reporting pathways at RPI and in the workplace. The event will be held on Tuesday, November 18, at 4 p.m. in the Bruggeman Room, CBIS, with Jackie McPhillips Balcerak and Elizabeth Brown-Goyette. All students, faculty, and staff are welcome.
item.author: Community

item.title: MMS Collaboration Software Training Series: RPI Digital Asset Management (DAM) System
item.description: Jim Evans, Director of MultiMedia Services, will present an overview of Rensselaer’s Digital Asset Management (DAM) System on Thursday November 20, from 11am-Noon. This webinar, hosted via webex, will include how to search, download, and manage campus-wide multimedia assets and will include a live demonstration and Q&A. Open to all members of the Rensselaer community. Registration is required: https://rensselaer.webex.com/weblink/register/r83f49d559584c35dc087ba5b15536931
item.author: Community

item.title: International Education Week (IEW) | Nov 17—21
item.description: IEW is an annual joint initiative of the U.S. Department of State and the U.S. Department of Education that promotes programs that prepare Americans for a global environment and attract future leaders from abroad to study, learn, and exchange experiences in the United States. It is an opportunity to celebrate and champion the benefits of international education and exchange worldwide. Please join Education Abroad/ISSS and our campus collaborators as we recognize this important week.
item.author: Community

item.title: Faculty & Staff Appreciation Lunch on November 19th
item.description:
We’re celebrating our incredible faculty and staff with a special Appreciation Lunch on Wednesday, November 19th! Join us at Commons or Russell Sage Dining Hall and enjoy a delicious meal for only $6 (plus tax).
